title: Photoelectric - new Kmax when frequency doubles

content.question: Light with a frequency <math alttext="f sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math> strikes the surface of a metal, causing electrons to be ejected from the surface with a maximum kinetic energy equal to value of the work function <math alttext="phi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>ϕ</mi></mstyle></math> of the metal. What is the new maximum kinetic energy of the ejected electrons if light of frequency <math alttext="2 f sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math> strikes the surface?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
